trans-unit.source: This article explains how to add dragging and dropping in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to add dragging and dropping in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop

trans-unit.target: Drag and drop

trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to add dragging and dropping in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to add dragging and dropping in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop is a classic, natural way of interacting with content such as images and files.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop is a classic, natural way of interacting with content such as images and files.

trans-unit.source: Once implemented, drag and drop works seamlessly in all directions, including app-to-app, app-to-desktop, and desktop-to app.
trans-unit.target: Once implemented, drag and drop works seamlessly in all directions, including app-to-app, app-to-desktop, and desktop-to app.

trans-unit.source: Set valid areas
trans-unit.target: Set valid areas

trans-unit.source: Use the [**AllowDrop**][AllowDrop] and [**CanDrag**][CanDrag] properties to designate the areas of your app valid for dragging and dropping.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**AllowDrop**][AllowDrop] and [**CanDrag**][CanDrag] properties to designate the areas of your app valid for dragging and dropping.

trans-unit.source: The markup below shows how to set a specific area of the app as a valid for dropping using the [**AllowDrop**][AllowDrop] in XAML.
trans-unit.target: The markup below shows how to set a specific area of the app as a valid for dropping using the [**AllowDrop**][AllowDrop] in XAML.

trans-unit.source: If a user tries to drop somewhere else, the system won't let them.
trans-unit.target: If a user tries to drop somewhere else, the system won't let them.

trans-unit.source: If you want users to be able to drop items anywhere on your app, set the entire background as a drop target.
trans-unit.target: If you want users to be able to drop items anywhere on your app, set the entire background as a drop target.

trans-unit.source: Main
trans-unit.target: Main

trans-unit.source: With dragging, you'll usually want to be specific about what's draggable.
trans-unit.target: With dragging, you'll usually want to be specific about what's draggable.

trans-unit.source: Users will want to drag certain items, like pictures, not everything in your app.
trans-unit.target: Users will want to drag certain items, like pictures, not everything in your app.

trans-unit.source: Here's how to set [**CanDrag**][CanDrag] using XAML.
trans-unit.target: Here's how to set [**CanDrag**][CanDrag] using XAML.

trans-unit.source: Main
trans-unit.target: Main

trans-unit.source: You don't need to do any other work to allow dragging, unless you want to customize the UI (which is covered later in this article).
trans-unit.target: You don't need to do any other work to allow dragging, unless you want to customize the UI (which is covered later in this article).

trans-unit.source: Dropping requires a few more steps.
trans-unit.target: Dropping requires a few more steps.

trans-unit.source: Handle the DragOver event
trans-unit.target: Handle the DragOver event

trans-unit.source: The [**DragOver**][DragOver] event fires when a user has dragged an item over your app, but not yet dropped it.
trans-unit.target: The [**DragOver**][DragOver] event fires when a user has dragged an item over your app, but not yet dropped it.

trans-unit.source: In this handler, you need to specify what kind of operations your app supports using the [**DragEventArgs.AcceptedOperation**][AcceptedOperation] property.
trans-unit.target: In this handler, you need to specify what kind of operations your app supports using the [**DragEventArgs.AcceptedOperation**][AcceptedOperation] property.

trans-unit.source: Copy is the most common.
trans-unit.target: Copy is the most common.

trans-unit.source: Main
trans-unit.target: Main

trans-unit.source: Process the Drop event
trans-unit.target: Process the Drop event

trans-unit.source: The [**Drop**][Drop] event occurs when the user releases items in a valid drop area.
trans-unit.target: The [**Drop**][Drop] event occurs when the user releases items in a valid drop area.

trans-unit.source: Process them using the [**DragEventArgs.DataView**][DataView] property.
trans-unit.target: Process them using the [**DragEventArgs.DataView**][DataView] property.

trans-unit.source: For simplicity in the example below, we'll assume the user dropped a single photo and access.
trans-unit.target: For simplicity in the example below, we'll assume the user dropped a single photo and access.

trans-unit.source: In reality, users can drop multiple items of varying formats simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: In reality, users can drop multiple items of varying formats simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: Your app should handle this possibility by checking what types of files were dropped and processing them accordingly, and notifying the user if they're trying to do something your app don't support.
trans-unit.target: Your app should handle this possibility by checking what types of files were dropped and processing them accordingly, and notifying the user if they're trying to do something your app don't support.

trans-unit.source: Main
trans-unit.target: Main

trans-unit.source: Customize the UI
trans-unit.target: Customize the UI

trans-unit.source: The system provides a default UI for dragging and dropping.
trans-unit.target: The system provides a default UI for dragging and dropping.

trans-unit.source: However, you can also choose to customize various parts of the UI by setting custom captions and glyphs, or by opting not to show a UI at all.
trans-unit.target: However, you can also choose to customize various parts of the UI by setting custom captions and glyphs, or by opting not to show a UI at all.

trans-unit.source: To customize the UI, use the [**DragUIOverride**][DragUiOverride] property in the [**DragOver**][DragOver] event handler.
trans-unit.target: To customize the UI, use the [**DragUIOverride**][DragUiOverride] property in the [**DragOver**][DragOver] event handler.
